首里城正殿内の防犯カメラ、出火時間帯に電源落ちる…電気設備トラブルか

05 Nov 2019, 03:11

　那覇市の首里城で起きた火災で、火元とみられる正殿内に設置された防犯カメラの電源が、出火時間帯に落ちていたことが、関係者への取材でわかった。沖縄県警は、電気設備のトラブルで出火した疑いがあるとみて調べている。
　首里城を管理・運営する一般財団法人「沖縄美（ちゅ）ら島財団」によると、正殿内には計７台の防犯カメラが設置されている。火災は１０月３１日未明に発生。午前２時３４分に正殿に設置したセンサーが北側付近の異常を感知し、駆けつけた警備員が内部を確認したところ、煙が充満していた。
　関係者によると、正殿では分電盤とみられる焦げた電気設備が見つかった。建物の外に設置された防犯カメラには、正殿の北東部分から炎が上がっている映像が確認されたという。
text:
Security camera inside Shurijo Castle, power is turned off during the fire.

05 Nov 2019, 03:11

According to interviews with the people concerned, the fire that occurred at Shuri Castle in Naha City was turning off the power of the security camera installed in the main hall, which seems to be the source of fire. The Okinawa Prefectural Police are investigating that there is a suspicion that a fire broke out due to a problem with electrical equipment.
According to the Okinawa Foundation, which manages and operates Shuri Castle, there are a total of seven security cameras in the main hall. A fire broke out before October 31st. At 2:34 am, a sensor installed in the main hall sensed an anomaly near the north side, and when a security guard rushed to the inside, it was full of smoke.
According to the officials, there was a burnt electrical facility that appeared to be a distribution board in the main hall. A security camera installed outside the building was confirmed to show a flame rising from the northeastern part of the main shrine.
